ETYMOLOGY: Named after John Montagu, 4th Earl of Sandwich (1718–1792), who reputedly requested meat served between two slices of bread so he could eat without interrupting a gambling game.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A meal or snack consisting of two pieces of bread with one or more fillings (such as meat, cheese, or vegetables) placed between them.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种食物，由两片面包夹着肉、奶酪或蔬菜等馅料制成。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I ordered a turkey and avocado sandwich on whole wheat bread.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我点了一个全麦面包夹火鸡和牛油果的三明治。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To place or squeeze something tightly between two other objects or things.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 将某物紧紧地夹在另外两物之间；挤压放置。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The advertisement was sandwiched between two long news articles.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这则广告被夹在两篇长篇新闻报道中间。
